channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: If Republicans Don’t Get The Economy Right, All Their Other Wins Will Be In Vain
item.description: The entire administration should spend every day convincing Americans that they're doing everything in their power to help families get ahead, for the...

item.title: The Right Way to Go After Venezuelan Drug Traffickers
item.description: If Trump believes that Venezuela is attacking the U.S. via a narco-terrorist proxy, he should ask Congress to authorize the use of military force.

item.title: Trump will seek 'Department of War' rebrand for Pentagon
item.description: President Trump will rename the Department of Defense to the Department of War through executive action, a move he's been hinting at for weeks.

item.title: How Can the White House, Congress, and Others Repair Damaged Trust in Official Statistics?
item.description: Without independence from political control, official statistics lack credibility and value.

item.title: FBI seized phones, computer equipment, folders during search of Bolton's home, records show
item.description: The FBI seized phones, computer equipment and typed documents from the home of John Bolton as part of an investigation into whether one of President D...

item.title: Outgoing Wisconsin Gov. Tony Evers Is Going Out With A Leftist Bang
item.description: After two terms as the vessel of the far left, Evers is leaving. And he has nothing to lose. Certainly not his dignity or integrity.

item.title: The Week: Trump Loses on Tariffs, Again
item.description: Plus: Is the United States at war with Venezuela?

item.title: Enough with the Gaza Famine Canard
item.description: Food insecurity in Gaza is being exaggerated, and few observing the real suffering there blame Hamas.

item.title: Monica Lewinsky Made Her Own Choices And Shouldn’t Exploit Real Victims
item.description: No matter how often Lewinsky reinvents herself, her constant, obvious attempts to recast herself in the role of victim are an affront to real victims.

item.title: Winning Big Looks Like Texas Passing A Bathroom Bill With Zero Corporate Shakedowns
item.description: With barely a whisper of corporate or public backlash, Texas' bathroom bill marks a seismic shift in American opinion on trans issues.

item.title: Trump: Zohran Mamdani likely to be New York mayor unless 2 opponents quit race
item.description: President Donald Trump said Thursday that he thinks Democrat Zohran Mamdani is likely to become New York City's next mayor unless two of the three maj...

item.title: Republican Gabriel Sterling, defender of 2020 Georgia election, runs for secretary of state
item.description: A former top elections official who made a name for himself defending Georgia's 2020 presidential election tally against threats from supporters of Pr...

item.title: Twinless Turns Love Inside Out
item.description: A heart-wrenching follow-up to James Sweeney’s stellar debut.

item.title: Maine’s ‘Reckless’ Secretary Of State Admits ‘Some’ Noncitizens Are On State’s Voter Rolls
item.description: Shenna Bellows, who has parlayed her activist brand of Trump Derangement Syndrome into a run for governor, refuses to open up voter files.

item.title: Chaotic showdown over Guatemalan children exposes fault lines in Trump's deportation push
item.description: Laura Pena knew she had two hours to stop the children she represents from being deported home to Guatemala. She and other lawyers and advocates aroun...
